TopicTitle: Steam users, how to get a clean install?

Articles.Content: How can you force KSP to get a clean install on Steam? If you delete local content, it brings it all back :T

1. Delete local content in steam.

2. Open my computer. Find steam folder. Find kerbal folder. Delete folder.

3. Re install Kerbal= Clean install.
Thanks a lot there, I deleted the mod data files but want to be sure.

Also make a copy of the clean install that way you can swap mod version and standard version in and out. I find this helps so you don't get one version loaded up with lots of mods.

G.

3. Re install Kerbal= Clean install.

How do you initiate the install process?

OK, finally managed to figure it out.

You have to right-click on Kerbal in your Steam library to delete local content.

Click on Kerbal in Steam.

Then Steam gives you the option to install.
